mythical.maze

Class HUD

  • java.lang.Object
    • mythical.maze.HUD

  • public class HUD
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a heads up display that displays user statistics, names and buttons.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HUD(int right, int l, int s, java.lang.String p)
      Constructor that sets up the heads up display.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Draws the items of the heads up display to the screen.
      double getElapsedTime()
      Returns the elapsed time for score calculation.
      void setCharacterPhase()
      Indicates a transition from block to character phase.
      void startTimer()
      Creates and starts the timer for scoring purposes.
      void stopTimer()
      Stops timer, used when block phase is over.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HUD

        public HUD(int right,
           int l,
           int s,
           java.lang.String p)
        Constructor that sets up the heads up display.
        Parameters:
        right - the right bound for the size of the display.
        l - the level of the player.
        s - the score of the player.
        p - the name of the player.

    • Method Detail

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        Creates and starts the timer for scoring purposes.

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        Stops timer, used when block phase is over.

      • drawHUD

        public void drawHUD(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    int gridSizeX,
                    int gridSizeY,
                    int uiArea)
        Draws the items of the heads up display to the screen.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics to paint onto.
        gridSizeX - an integer that represents the horizontal length of the grid.
        gridSizeY - an integer that represents the vertical length of the grid.
        uiArea - an integer that represents the area of the grid to offset.

      • setCharacterPhase

        public void setCharacterPhase()
        Indicates a transition from block to character phase.

      • getElapsedTime

        public double getElapsedTime()
        Returns the elapsed time for score calculation.
        Returns:
        time the elapsed time.
